An Object-Oriented World

An Object-Oriented World

  • Example: Watching TV
    • From “Learn Java Now”, Stephen R. Davis, Microsoft Press
  • A TV is a physical object
    • A TV is a well-defined concept with well-defined boundaries
    • The concept of TV is universally understood
  • A TV remote control provides user interface
    • No other interface is needed
    • No additional knowledge of TV internals is needed
  • A TV “works” right out of the box
    • Robust, fully operational, not expected to fail
    • Its relations/ attachments to the world are fully documented
